geneVariantDescriptions.description: NFATC3-PLA2G15 results from the fusion of NFATC3 and PLA2G15, which has unclear functional effect as it is associated with decreased Nfatc3 transactivation compared to wild-type Nfatc3 in a reporter assay (PMID: 29330284), however, may be required for expression of mesenchymal genes, colony formation, proliferation and invasion in cell culture assays (PMID: 29909608), and therefore, the effect on protein function is unknown. NFATC3-PLA2G15 fusions have been demonstrated in acute myeloid leukemia (PMID: 23251452) and lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 27058892).

references.title: NFATC3-PLA2G15 Fusion Transcript Identified by RNA Sequencing Promotes Tumor Invasion and Proliferation in Colorectal Cancer Cell Lines.
New fusion transcripts identified in normal karyotype acute myeloid leukemia.
Read-through transcripts in normal human lung parenchyma are down-regulated in lung adenocarcinoma.
Novel Intergenically Spliced Chimera, NFATC3-PLA2G15, Is Associated with Aggressive T-ALL Biology and Outcome.
